publicationStmt.p: A collaborative edition of the marginal commentary on Codex Bodmer 25

sourceDesc.p: Cologny, Fondation Martin Bodmer, Cod. Bodmer 25: Tetraevangelium (http://www.e-codices.unifr.ch/en/list/one/cb/0025). Parchment · (2) 196+23 bis (2) ff. · 31.9 x 24.8 cm · Constantinople · end of the 10th century. A remarkable manuscript from the end of the 10th century, undoubtedly produced in either Constantinople or Smyrna, CB 25 presents all four Gospels together in Greek. The biblical text is accompanied by commentaries by Peter of Laodiceia (an exegetical chain) written in cursive. The volume is decorated with two valuable full-page miniatures representing Luke and Mark against gold backgrounds. (mes)

p.seg: The book of the geneaology is of the man born from from the seed of David according to the flesh: wherefore begat is said of all.
And the genesis of Christ is not a journey from not-being into being; but a journey from beginning in the form of God to the assumption of the form of a slave.

And concerning the Teachings deriving a Being from On High, but with the Evangelists having made one on the contrary, there is no need to blame. For this manner of writing was dear from of old to the Hebrews, and customary for Holy Scripture.

Nor would someone say that those making an uphill and straight journey, and those going down along the say road, are walking different roads, when one path lies under the feet of those going up and those going down.

And even if women are not reckoned in genealogical pedigrees, but since Christ (the Being in the flesh), was born from only the Virgin, and this woman was of the clan of David, He himself is reasonably reckoned in the genealogical pedigree of David himself.
And He is mentioned from him first, and not from Abraham, since they had more recent memories concerning him, and because he was a prophet and a king and glorified amont them.
And he was called The One Coming, who is “the Messiah” [Christos]; for David was a archetype of the Messiah [Christos].

For just as that man became king after Saul was rejected as unfit, thus also Christ, after Adam was first expelled, was King of all.
ὥσπερ γὰρ ἐκεῖνος μετὰ τὸ ἀποδοκιμασθῆναι τὸν Σαοὺλ ἑβασίλευσεν, οὕτω καὶ ὁ Χριστὸς μετὰ τὸ ἐκβληθῆναι τὸν πρῶτον Ἀδὰμ, βασιλεὺς τῶν ἁπαντων.
τοῦ Ἀβραὰμ δὲ καὶ τοῦ Δαβὶδ κατ' ἀρχὴν μόνων ἐμνήσθη, ἐπειδὴ πρὸς αὐτοὺς ἡ ἐπαγγελία τῆς τοῦ λόγου σαρκώσεως γέγονεν.
